DOC.brief_title: Does Bicarbonate Addition Theophylline Reduce CIN ?
DOC.criteria: Increased risk contrast induce nephropathy define : Serum creatinine level ≥ 1.1 mg/dl OR Serum creatinine level ≥ 0.8 mg/dl plus additional risk factor like diabetes mellitus , renal failure past medical history nephrotoxic medication ( aminoglycoside , vancomycin , amphotericin B , diuretic ) preexist renal replacement therapy unstable serum creatinine level ( difference ±0.4 mg/dl within 3 day contrast application ) contraindication theophylline sodium bicarbonate ( allergy , tachycardia , alkalosis , hypokalemia ) additional intervention might influence renal function
